xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.aggregates

Class Aggregators

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.aggregates.Aggregators

  • public class Aggregators
extends Object
    This class provides some static methods showing how one is able to use aggregation functions and online aggregation functions of higher orders, i.e., initial statistical functions and aggregation functions based on different aggregation functions. In regard to more complex applications, preimplementations of kernel based methods are particularly provided.
    See Also:
    Aggregator, AdaptiveAggregationFunction, ReservoirSampler, AdaptiveWeightFunctions, SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction, xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.aggregates, xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels

    • Method Detail

      • getNKDEAggregator

        public static Aggregator getNKDEAggregator(Iterator input,
                                           KernelFunction kf,
                                           int sampleSize,
                                           int samplingType,
                                           int bandwidthType)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering a native kernel density estimator as result of the aggregation. The aggregates base on an input iterator delivering data of type Object. While consuming the iterator, an iid sample of the previously seen data is maintained that in turn is used for establishing a new native kernel density estimator.
        Generally, the following steps are required:

        1. Use a reservoir sampling function (or any other online sampling algorithm) to obtain an iterator delivering samples of an input iterator.
        2. Use an aggregation function delivering an estimation of the spread (e.g. standard deviation, inter quartil range, ...) of the data.
        3. Combine the aggregation functions above within a new aggregator and use the tuples delivered by this iteration as input for an aggregation function of higher order. 



         return new Aggregator(
        new Aggregator( input,
                         new Function [] {
                                mapSamplingStrategy( sampleSize, samplingType),
                                new StatefulVariance()}
                        ),
        new NKDEAggregateFunction( kf)
 );
        Parameters:
        input - data used to obtain an estimation of the pdf
        kf - used kernel function to obtain an estimator
        sampleSize - used sample size
        samplingType - used type of sampling
        bandwidthType - used bandwidth strategy
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering density estimators based on an input iterator
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getNKCDFAggregator

        public static Aggregator getNKCDFAggregator(Iterator input,
                                            KernelFunction kf,
                                            int sampleSize,
                                            int samplingType,
                                            int bandwidthType)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering a native kernel cdf as result of the aggregation. The aggregates base on an input iterator delivering data of type Object. While consuming the iterator, an iid sample of the previously seen data is maintained that in turn is used for establishing a new native kernel cdf.
        Generally, the following steps are required:

        1. Use a reservoir sampling function (or any other online sampling algorithm) to obtain an iterator delivering samples of an input iterator.
        2. Use an aggregation function delivering an estimation of the spread (e.g. standard deviation, inter quartil range, ...) of the data.
        3. Combine the aggregation functions above within a new aggregator and use the tuples delivered by this iteration as input for an aggregation function of higher order. 

         return new Aggregator(
                        new Aggregator(
                                input,
                                new Function[] {
                                        mapSamplingStrategy(sampleSize, samplingType),
                                        new StatefulVariance()}),
                        new NativeKernelCDFAggregateFunction(kf, bandwidthType));
        Parameters:
        input - data used to obtain an estimation
        kf - used kernel function to obtain an estimator
        sampleSize - used sample size
        samplingType - used type of sampling
        bandwidthType - used bandwidth strategy
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering native kernel cdf's based on an input iterator
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getRKDEAggregator

        public static Aggregator getRKDEAggregator(Iterator input,
                                           KernelFunction kf,
                                           int sampleSize,
                                           int samplingType,
                                           int bandwidthType)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering an reflection kernel density estimator using reflection as the result of the aggregation. The aggregates base on an input iterator delivering data of type Object. While consuming the iterator, an iid sample of the previously seen data is maintained that in turn is used for establishing a new reflection kernel density estimator.
        Generally, the following steps are required:

        1. Use a reservoir sampling function (or any other online sampling algorithm) to obtain an iterator delivering samples of an input iterator.
        2. Use an aggregation function delivering an estimation of the spread (e.g. standard deviation, inter quartil range, ...) of the data.
        3. Combine the aggregation functions above within a new aggregator and use the tuples delivered by this iteration as input for an aggregation function of higher order. 



         return new Aggregator(
        new Aggregator( input,
                         new Function [] {
                                mapSamplingStrategy( sampleSize, samplingType),
                                new StatefulVariance(),
                                 new Minimum(),
                                 new Maximum()}
                        ),
        new RKDEAggregateFunction( kf)
 );
        Parameters:
        input - data used to obtain an estimation
        kf - used kernel function to obtain an estimator
        sampleSize - used sample size
        samplingType - used type of sampling
        bandwidthType - used bandwidth strategy
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering reflection kernel density estimators based on an input iterator
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getRKCDFAggregator

        public static Aggregator getRKCDFAggregator(Iterator input,
                                            KernelFunction kf,
                                            int sampleSize,
                                            int samplingType,
                                            int bandwidthType)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering a reflection kernel cdf as result of the aggregation. The aggregates base on an input iterator delivering data of type Object. While consuming the iterator, an iid sample of the previously seen data is maintained that in turn is used for establishing a new reflection kernel cdf.
        Generally, the following steps are required:

        1. Use a reservoir sampling function (or any other on-line sampling algorithm) to obtain an iterator delivering samples of an input iterator.
        2. Use an aggregation function delivering an estimation of the spread (e.g. standard deviation, inter quartil range, ...) of the data.
        3. Combine the aggregation functions above within a new aggregator and use the tuples delivered by this iteration as input for an aggregation function of higher order. 

         return new Aggregator(
                        new Aggregator(
                                input,
                                new Function[] {
                                        mapSamplingStrategy(sampleSize, samplingType),
                                        new StatefulVariance(),
                                        new Minimum(),
                                        new Maximum()
                                }
                        ),
                        new ReflectionKernelCDFAggregateFunction(kf, bandwidthType)
                );
        Parameters:
        input - data used to obtain an estimation
        kf - used kernel function to obtain an estimator
        sampleSize - used sample size
        samplingType - used type of sampling
        bandwidthType - used bandwidth strategy
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering reflection kernel cdf's based on an input iterator
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getReservoirBasedKernelEstimatorAggregator

        public static Aggregator getReservoirBasedKernelEstimatorAggregator(Iterator input,
                                                                    AggregationFunction kernelBasedAggregateFunction,
                                                                    int sampleSize,
                                                                    int samplingType)
                                                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering estimators as result of the aggregation. They rely on a user-defined aggregate function for building estimators based on a sample and statistical values (e.g. variance). The aggregates base on an input iterator delivering data of type Object. While consuming the iterator, an iid sample of the previously seen data is maintained that in turn is used for establishing a new kernel based estimator.
        Generally, the following steps are required:

        1. Use a reservoir sampling function (or any other online sampling algorithm) to obtain an iterator delivering samples of an input iterator.
        2. Use an aggregation function delivering an estimation of the spread (e.g. standard deviation, inter quartil range, ...) of the data.
        3. Combine the aggregation functions above within a new aggregator and use the tuples delivered by this iteration as input for an aggregation function of higher order. 



         return new Aggregator(
                        new Aggregator(
                                input,
                                new Function[] {
                                        mapSamplingStrategy(sampleSize, samplingType),
                                        new StatefulVariance(),
                                        new Minimum(),
                                        new Maximum()
                                }
                        ),
                        kernelBasedAggregateFunction
                );
        Parameters:
        input - data used to obtain an estimation
        kernelBasedAggregateFunction - aggregation function
        sampleSize - used sample size
        samplingType - used type of sampling
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering reflection kernel cdf's based on an input iterator
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getAdaptiveKernelBasedAggregator

        public static Aggregator getAdaptiveKernelBasedAggregator(Function factory,
                                                          Iterator input,
                                                          KernelFunction kf,
                                                          int bandwidthType,
                                                          int blocksize,
                                                          RealFunction weights,
                                                          boolean realMode)
                                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering estimators as result of the aggregation. An iterator containing Objects of type Number is partitioned into blocks of a predefined size. While consuming the iterator, separate kernel based estimators with a chosen bandwidth strategy are established for each block. In each step, after the new estimator is built, a convex linear combination of the 'old' and the 'new' estimator will be returned as the actual aggregation result. There exist different strategies for the weights of the estimators. They are provided in {xxl.core.math.functions.AdaptiveWeightFunctions AdaptiveWeightFunctions}. The construction of the aggregates according to the current step and weights is realized in AdaptiveAggregationFunction. 


         return new Aggregator(
                        KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.inputCursor(input, blocksize),
                        new AdaptiveAggregationFunction(
                                new KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction(factory, kf, bandwidthType),
                                weights,
                                realMode
                        )
                );
        Parameters:
        factory - factory delivering kernel based estimators for each block
        input - data stream to build an adaptive estimator (must contain Objects of type Number)
        kf - used kernel function to build up the block based estimator
        bandwidthType - type of bandwidth used by each block estimator
        blocksize - size of each block performed separately and used to build an estimator
        weights - RealFunction delivering weights used to combine the blockestimators
        realMode - indicates that the adaptive aggregation function assumes to combine Objects of type RealFunction instead of Objects of type Function consuming Objects of type Number.
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering kernel based estimators that are iteratively combined
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getSplineCompressedAdaptiveKernelBasedAggregator

        public static Aggregator getSplineCompressedAdaptiveKernelBasedAggregator(Function factory,
                                                                          Iterator input,
                                                                          KernelFunction kf,
                                                                          int bandwidthType,
                                                                          int blocksize,
                                                                          RealFunction weights,
                                                                          double left,
                                                                          double right,
                                                                          int n,
                                                                          boolean realMode,
                                                                          boolean cdfMode)
                                                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering kernel based estimators as result of the aggregation. An iterator containing Objects of type Number is partitioned into blocks of a predefined size. While consuming the iterator, separate kernel based estimators with a chosen bandwidth strategy are established for each block. In each step, after the new estimator is built, a convex linear combination of the 'old' and the 'new' estimator will be returned as the actual aggregation result. There exist different strategies for the weights of the estimators. They are provided in {xxl.core.math.functions.AdaptiveWeightFunctions AdaptiveWeightFunctions}. The construction of the aggregates according to the current step and weights is realized in AdaptiveAggregationFunction. In regard to the limited memory resources, the current aggregate is compressed. Therefore, the cubic Bezier-Spline interpolate for the aggregate is computed, whereas a predefined number of function values of the aggregate on an interval is computed. The compression of a new aggregate is realized in SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction. The compression range, i.e., the interval for the compression, has to be known. 


         return new Aggregator(
                        KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.inputCursor(input, blocksize),
                        new SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction(
                                new AdaptiveAggregationFunction(
                                        new KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction(factory, kf, bandwidthType),
                                        weights,
                                        realMode
                                ),
                                new EveryNth(blocksize),
                                left,
                                right,
                                n,
                                cdfMode
                        )
                );
        Parameters:
        factory - factory delivering kernel based estimators for each block
        input - data stream to build an adaptive estimator (must contain Objects of type Number)
        kf - used kernel function to build up the block based estimator
        bandwidthType - type of bandwidth used by each block estimator
        blocksize - size of each block performed separately and used to build up an estimator
        weights - RealFunction delivering weights used to combine the block estimators
        left - left border of the valid compression range
        right - right border of the valid compression range
        n - number of points in the compression interval
        realMode - indicates that the adaptive aggregation function assumes to combine Objects of type RealFunction instead of Objects of type Function consuming Objects of type Number.
        cdfMode - indicates spline is in cdf mode, i.e., evaluating the spline at x > maximum causes the spline to return 1.0 instead of 0.0
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering kernel based estimators that are iteratively combined and compressed in each aggregation step
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getSplineCompressedAdaptiveKernelBasedAggregator

        public static Aggregator getSplineCompressedAdaptiveKernelBasedAggregator(Function factory,
                                                                          Iterator input,
                                                                          KernelFunction kf,
                                                                          int bandwidthType,
                                                                          int blocksize,
                                                                          RealFunction weights,
                                                                          int n,
                                                                          boolean realMode,
                                                                          boolean cdfMode)
                                                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering kernel based estimators as result of the aggregation. An iterator containing Objects of type Number is partitioned into blocks of a predefined size. While consuming the iterator, separate kernel based estimators with a chosen bandwidth strategy are established for each block. In each step, after the new estimator is built, a convex linear combination of the 'old' and the 'new' estimator will be returned as the actual aggregation result. There exist different strategies for the weights of the estimators. They are provided in {xxl.core.math.functions.AdaptiveWeightFunctions AdaptiveWeightFunctions}. The construction of the aggregates according to the current step and weights is realized in AdaptiveAggregationFunction. In regard to the limited memory resources, the current aggregate is compressed. Therefore, the cubic Bezier-Spline interpolate for the aggregate is computed, whereas a predefined number of function values of the aggregate on an interval is computed. The compression of a new aggregate is realized in SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction. The compression range in turn relies on the current extrema. 


         return new Aggregator(
                        KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.inputCursor(input, blocksize),
                        new SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction(
                                new AdaptiveAggregationFunction(
                                        new KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction(factory, kf, bandwidthType),
                                        weights,
                                        realMode
                                ),
                                new EveryNth(blocksize),
                                KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.accessValue(
                                        KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.MINIMUM),
                                KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.accessValue(
                                        KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.MAXIMUM),
                                new Constant(new Double(n)),
                                cdfMode
                        )
                );
        Parameters:
        factory - factory delivering kernel based estimators for each block
        input - data stream to build an adaptive estimator (must contain Objects of type Number)
        kf - used kernel function to build up the block based estimator
        bandwidthType - type of bandwidth used by each block estimator
        blocksize - size of each block performed separately and used to build up an estimator
        weights - RealFunction delivering weights used to combine the block estimators
        n - number of points in the compression interval
        realMode - indicates that the adaptive aggregation function assumes to combine Objects of type RealFunction instead of Objects of type Function consuming Objects of type Number.
        cdfMode - indicates spline is in cdf mode, i.e., evaluating the spline at x > maximum causes the spline to return 1.0 instead of 0.0
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering kernel based estimators that are iteratively combined and compressed in each aggregation step
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getSplineCompressedAdaptiveAggregator

        public static Aggregator getSplineCompressedAdaptiveAggregator(Function factory,
                                                               Iterator input,
                                                               int blocksize,
                                                               RealFunction weights,
                                                               double left,
                                                               double right,
                                                               int n,
                                                               boolean realMode,
                                                               boolean cdfMode)
                                                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering estimators based on a FACTORY as result of the aggregation. An iterator containing Objects of type Number is partitioned into blocks of a predefined size. While consuming the iterator, separate estimators are established for each block. In each step, after the new estimator is built, a convex linear combination of the 'old' and the 'new' estimator will be returned as the actual aggregation result. There exist different strategies for the weights of the estimators. They are provided in {xxl.core.math.functions.AdaptiveWeightFunctions AdaptiveWeightFunctions}. The construction of the aggregates according to the current step and weights is realized in AdaptiveAggregationFunction. In regard to the limited memory resources, the current aggregate is compressed. Therefore, the cubic Bezier-Spline interpolate for the aggregate is computed, whereas a predefined number of function values of the aggregate on an interval is computed. The compression of a new aggregate is realized in SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction. The compression range, i.e., the interval for the compression, has to be known. 


         return new Aggregator(
                        input,
                        new SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction(
                                new AdaptiveAggregationFunction(
                                        new AbstractFunction() {
                                                int c = 0;
                                                public Object invoke(Object old, Object next) {
                                                        c++;
                                                        if (next == null)
                                                                return null;
                                                        if (c % blocksize == 0)
                                                                return factory.invoke((Object[]) next);
                                                        else
                                                                return old;
                                        }
                                }, 
                                weights, realMode), new EveryNth(blocksize), left, right, n, cdfMode
                        )
                );
        Parameters:
        factory - factory delivering estimators for each block
        input - data stream to build an adaptive estimator (must contain Objects of type Number)
        blocksize - size of each block performed separately and used to build up an estimator
        weights - RealFunction delivering weights used to combine the block estimators
        left - left border of valid compression range
        right - right border of valid compression range
        n - number of points in the compression interval
        realMode - indicates that the adaptive aggregation function assumes to combine Objects of type RealFunction instead of Objects of type Function consuming Objects of type Number.
        cdfMode - indicates spline is in cdf mode, i.e., evaluating the spline at x > maximum causes the spline to return 1.0 instead of 0.0
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering estimators that are iteratively combined and compressed in each aggregation step
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getEmpiricalCDFAggregator

        public static Aggregator getEmpiricalCDFAggregator(Iterator input,
                                                   int sampleSize,
                                                   int samplingType)
                                            throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering an empirical cdf as result of the aggregation. The aggregates base on an input iterator delivering data of type Object. While consuming the iterator, an iid sample of the previously seen data is maintained that in turn is used for establishing a new empirical cdf.
        Generally, the following steps are required:

        1. Use a reservoir sampling function (or any other online sampling algorithm) to obtain an iterator delivering samples of an input iterator.
        2. Use an aggregation function delivering an estimation of the spread (e.g. standard deviation, inter quartil range, ...) of the data.
        3. Combine the aggregation functions above within a new aggregator and use the tuples delivered by this iteration as input for an aggregation function of higher order. 



         return new Aggregator(
                        new Aggregator(input, mapSamplingStrategy(sampleSize, samplingType)),
                        new EmpiricalCDFAggregateFunction()
                );
        Parameters:
        input - data used to obtain an estimation of the pdf
        sampleSize - used sample size
        samplingType - used type of sampling
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering the empirical cdf
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • getSplineCompressedAdaptiveEmpiricalCDFAggregator

        public static Aggregator getSplineCompressedAdaptiveEmpiricalCDFAggregator(Iterator input,
                                                                           int blocksize,
                                                                           RealFunction weights,
                                                                           int n)
                                                                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an iterator of type aggregator delivering empirical cdf's as result of the aggregation. An iterator containing Objects of type Number is partitioned into blocks of a predefined size. While consuming the iterator, separate empirical cdf's are established for each block. In each step, after the new estimator is built, a convex linear combination of the 'old' and the 'new' estimator will be returned as the actual aggregation result. There exist different strategies for the weights of the estimators. They are provided in {xxl.core.math.functions.AdaptiveWeightFunctions AdaptiveWeightFunctions}. The construction of the aggregates according to the current step and weights is realized in AdaptiveAggregationFunction. In regard to the limited memory resources, the current aggregate is compressed. Therefore, the cubic Bezier-Spline interpolate for the aggregate is computed, whereas a predefined number of function values of the aggregate on an interval is computed. The compression of a new aggregate is realized in SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction. The compression range relies on the current extrema. 


         return new Aggregator(
                        new Aggregator(input, new Function[] { new LastN(blocksize), new Minimum(), new Maximum()}),
                        new SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction(
                                new AdaptiveAggregationFunction(
                                        new AbstractFunction() {
                                                int c = 0;
                                                public Object invoke(Object old, Object next) {
                                                        c++;
                                                        if (next == null)
                                                                return null;
                                                        if (c % blocksize == 0)
                                                                return EmpiricalCDF.FACTORY.invoke(((Object[]) next)[0]);
                                                        else
                                                                return old;
                                                }
                                        },
                                        weights, true // real mode
                                ),
                                new EveryNth(blocksize),
                                KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.accessValue(1),
                                KernelBasedBlockEstimatorAggregationFunction.accessValue(2),
                                new Constant(new Double(n)),
                                true // cdf mode
                        )
                );
        Parameters:
        input - data stream to build an adaptive estimator (must contain Objects of type Number)
        blocksize - size of each block performed separately and used to build up an estimator
        weights - RealFunction delivering weights used to combine the block estimators
        n - number of points in the compression interval
        Returns:
        an aggregator delivering empirical cdf's that are iteratively combined and compressed in each aggregation step
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given samplingType is not known

      • mapSamplingStrategy

        public static AggregationFunction mapSamplingStrategy(int sampleSize,
                                                      int type)
                                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        The method returns a function representing a strategy used with the ReservoirSampler cursor.
        Parameters:
        sampleSize - size of the sample
        type - type of the reservoir sampling strategy
        Returns:
        a function representing a reservoir sampling strategy
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown or not supported strategy has been given
